Package com.example

Class TopologyApi

java.lang.Object
com.example.TopologyApi
All Implemented Interfaces:
Api
public class TopologyApi
extends java.lang.Object
implements Api
this class implements Api interface and used to deal with topology json files

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    TopologyApi()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean deleteTopology​(java.lang.String topologyId)
    this method deletes a topology specified with its id from memory
    java.util.List<Component> getComponentsWithNode​(Topology tp, java.lang.String node)
    this method takes a specific topology and a specific node to get all components in that topology [Note] it is a helper method with queryDevicesWithNetListNode() function that are connected to that node
    java.util.List<Component> queryDevices​(java.lang.String topologyId)
    this method returns the number of devices for specific topology
    java.util.List<Component> queryDevicesWithNetListNode​(java.lang.String topologyId, java.lang.String node)
    this method returns the number of devices that are connected to a specific node for specific topology
    java.util.List<Topology> queryTopology()
    this method returns the number of topologies in memory
    boolean readJson​(java.lang.String fileName)
    this method reads a json file that contains topology configuration and store it in memory as a topology object
    java.lang.String writeJson​(java.lang.String topologyId)
    this method takes a topology id, searches for it in memory and returns a json string representing this topology [Note] this method should be used with the help of another method to write the returned json string in a specified file

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      public TopologyApi()

  • Method Details

    • readJson

      public boolean readJson​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.io.IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      this method reads a json file that contains topology configuration and store it in memory as a topology object
      Specified by:
      readJson in interface Api
      Parameters:
      fileName - the file path of json file that contains the topology
      Returns:
      returns true if the file is read and stored in memory correctly
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is an error in file path
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - if there is an error in parsing the json file (inappropriate format)

    • writeJson

      public java.lang.String writeJson​(java.lang.String topologyId)
      this method takes a topology id, searches for it in memory and returns a json string representing this topology [Note] this method should be used with the help of another method to write the returned json string in a specified file
      Specified by:
      writeJson in interface Api
      Parameters:
      topologyId - a string represents the topology id to read from memory and store in another json file
      Returns:
      a json string of the topology read from memory if the topology is already in the memory and an empty string "" if the topology is not the memory

    • queryTopology

      public java.util.List<Topology> queryTopology()
      this method returns the number of topologies in memory
      Specified by:
      queryTopology in interface Api
      Returns:
      a list of Topology objects that are in memory or null if the memory is empty

    • deleteTopology

      public boolean deleteTopology​(java.lang.String topologyId)
      this method deletes a topology specified with its id from memory
      Specified by:
      deleteTopology in interface Api
      Parameters:
      topologyId - the id of the topology to be deleted
      Returns:
      true if the topology is deleted or false if the topology is not in memory

    • queryDevices

      public java.util.List<Component> queryDevices​(java.lang.String topologyId)
      this method returns the number of devices for specific topology
      Specified by:
      queryDevices in interface Api
      Parameters:
      topologyId - the id of the topology that has devices
      Returns:
      a list of component objects that are in the topology or null if the topology is not in memory

    • queryDevicesWithNetListNode

      public java.util.List<Component> queryDevicesWithNetListNode​(java.lang.String topologyId, java.lang.String node)
      this method returns the number of devices that are connected to a specific node for specific topology
      Specified by:
      queryDevicesWithNetListNode in interface Api
      Parameters:
      topologyId - the id of the topology that has devices
      node - the node to searchh for devices that are connected to it
      Returns:
      a list of component objects that are connected to the node null if the topology is not in memory or there are no components connected to that node in that topology

    • getComponentsWithNode

      public java.util.List<Component> getComponentsWithNode​(Topology tp, java.lang.String node)
      this method takes a specific topology and a specific node to get all components in that topology [Note] it is a helper method with queryDevicesWithNetListNode() function that are connected to that node
      Parameters:
      tp - the topology object
      node - the node to search for it
      Returns:
      a list of Components that are connected to that node or null if there are no components conncted to that node
